Articles.Content:
I'd like to see the configuration used for a part that I have added based on a MMConfig.

Is there a way to view the active configuration file of a part while the game is running?

Moving to Add-on Discussion.

ModuleManager has a debug menu that you can pop up in the KSC scene by pressing ALT+F11.  I don't have my KSP computer in front of me right now, but I think one of the options on that dialog may be to dump config to a file, or some such.  (Apologies if I've got things mixed up and it doesn't actually do that-- this is based on a vague memory of having seen something like that, it's not a function I've ever used myself.)

That menu can come in handy when debugging config-- it includes an option to reload all the config, without having to restart KSP, which is a godsend when I'm tweaking things and have to iterate a lot.

Can confirm MM does this. It makes a subfolder named MMCfg and a .cfg file for each part as it loads in the game.

D.

Edited December 21, 2016 by Diazo

Thanks guys!!! 

Just an FYI, for those of us on linux it's

RShift+F11

and the folder is 

_MMCfgOutput
This can also help, I think.
